intro: Moquilea guianensis, commonly known as the Guianese moquilea, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its large, showy flowers that typically bloom in shades of red and yellow. Its leaves are broad and heart-shaped, often with a hairy texture. Moquilea guianensis is adapted to grow in moist, shady environments, often found in forest understories.
